abstract.p: David Saltonstall letter praises South Beach, in Miami Beach, even though some of its inhabitants may go to extremes to become and stay beautiful (May 28 article)

block.p: While South Beach, in Miami Beach, is indeed a haven for narcissists of all stripes and colors (''Beauty Reigns Supreme in a Florida Enclave,'' front page, May 28), and the people-watching is certainly supreme, it boasts multiple attractions for regular folks as well.

These include the Wolfsonian's wonderful Art Deco collections, a first-class ballet company and symphony orchestra, theater offerings, restaurants of every kind and price range, and an opportunity to stroll amid colorful architecture in a historic district where high-rise buildings do not predominate.

While South Beach, in Miami Beach, is indeed a haven for narcissists of all stripes and colors (''Beauty Reigns Supreme in a Florida Enclave,'' front page, May 28), and the people-watching is certainly supreme, it boasts multiple attractions for regular folks as well.

These include the Wolfsonian's wonderful Art Deco collections, a first-class ballet company and symphony orchestra, theater offerings, restaurants of every kind and price range, and an opportunity to stroll amid colorful architecture in a historic district where high-rise buildings do not predominate.

The inhabitants, both permanent and transient, are certainly diverse, but a wonderful sense of respect for all cultures and types prevails. Beauty, after all, is in the eye of the beholder, and when the cold breezes blow, I head for my little place there with anticipation and pleasure.
